Generation V.Black: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
Generation V.White: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.
Generation V.Black 2: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.
Generation V.White 2: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.

Generation VI.X: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.
Generation VI.Y: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It generates energy from sunlight, then amplifies that energy dozens of times within its long body.
Generation IX.Violet: An intimidating gaze and majestic appearance have caused this Pokémon to be known as the Lord of the Forest.
